TopicTitle: FIXED! My Most Accurate SR-71 Blackbird Yet!

Articles.Content:
I practically did this bird with every subsequent version of KSP since they first implemented the SPH; but man, I just can't express my love enough for this delta-winged beauty. Since this version came out, this was all that was on my mind: "Rebuild the Blackbird." I did, and I went through trial and error of getting all the stock parts to look JUUUUST right, to closely match the real deal. Well, in the end, this is my most accurate, and most balanced Blackbird I have ever built. I managed to climb to over 30,000 metres, and managed to get above mach 4 in this, and it has more than enough fuel to circumnavigate Kerbin.

\/IMPORTANT INFO!\/

Keep in mind that this bird is still fragile on the tarmac. If you punch it, and try to take off as you normally would, the engines WILL disintegrate, and your outer deltas WILL go on without you. Bring her nose up ever so gently, and let the lift gradually make its way under the wings. One MOOOORE thing! I purposely left the 2 rear fuel tanks closed off to maintain Center of Mass balance, the one that's open will get you very far. Also, the reason I put a cargo bay behind the capsule was to lighten the load. You can replace it with a fuel tank IF you so choose, but it WILL upset the balance a bit. EDIT: I fixed the craft file. Re-DL the file, and you'll be fine. I'm terribly sorry for the inconvenience!

/\IMPORTANT INFO!/\

I have several screenshots available on my Dropbox in the link below.

^ Click Me! ^

And here's the link to my craft file.

^ Click Me! ^

What did you think of my stock replica? Did I do a good job? Does it fly okay? Have problems? Drop a comment below and let me know what you think!

And as always, fly safe!

Bluefalcon77

Edited October 26, 2014 by BlueFalcon77
Craft File Fix

Ooo neato i just finished making my own sr71, ill have to download yours and take a look

here is a link to mine if you want to take a look

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/98119-SR-71-replica-white-bird

Yours looks pretty good for a starter. You gotta learn that any surface can be used for the wings, not just the black center line. Of course you'll need to know where to place struts as well, where the parts aren't DIRECTLY connected to other parts. Otherwise, you're on your way. Keep it up, fellow kerbonaut!

Yours looks pretty good for a starter. You gotta learn that any surface can be used for the wings, not just the black center line. Of course you'll need to know where to place struts as well, where the parts aren't DIRECTLY connected to other parts. Otherwise, you're on your way. Keep it up, fellow kerbonaut!

Fairly sure mine is structurally sound, the rear end is set up like it is for landings so the gear bounces up and down more (the wings are connected internally with space tape) makes for good suspension, did not want to do external suspension, as far as placement of the wings, i rather have the centre of lift even on the centre of mass, could not get the shape of the SR-71 air intakes to be a reality in KSP so i went with flyability on that part, otherwise my plane is a fairly accurate on the shape.

Btw still cant use yours without mods, just going to download the mod lol, is it near future struts?

Wow, super nice! The real Blackbird didn't have that sort of agility, though. Had a wicked turn radius in the hundreds of miles at speed. I like it a lot, though. I'll go and download yours, since you did mine.

And I appreciate your criticism on mine, I know it's a bit clunky for trying to do acrobatics, but mine was built mainly for the sole purpose of being a supersonic spyplane.

Thanks for sharing!

i ended up having to clip controls into the nose of the plane to stop it dipping below the horizon in the upper atmosphere, so it handles a bit unrealistically lol, i added some extra yaw control as well because it had nearly none.

did make it so it will fly at 3500+km/h at 25km.

you too man, cant wait to see what you bring out next.

All right. I might actually crank out a U-2 Dragonlady next, complete with the tried-and-true 3d wing design like I did here. Though I MIGHT need to set a cap on how much throttle for it, as it was not very fast compared to the SR-71.

I also saw from your video that your top speed was a little over 1,247 metres/sec (4,489.2 km/hr). Mine clocked out at over 1,500 metres/sec (5,400 km/hr) at 27+ kilometres up.

I was still accelerating after this was taken.

No need to keep bringing up a comment from the front page, since the two people it concerns have moved on and didn't have a problem with it in the first place. Constructive comments are always welcome, but there's no need to stir up trouble where there isn't any.

Cheers,

~Claw
Yup. Its a great way of making things look good with stock parts, and from personal experience, it doesn't strain your cpu. Its a little buggy, but I found my way around it.

I still don't understand why it is so hard to embed at least 1 pic in the main post? No pics, no clicks.

If you have problems I'll just guide you.

1. Go to imgur.com

2. Log in with facebook/google/whatever

3. Upload your screenshot using one of the methods there(drag and drop, select etc.)

4. Open the uploaded screenie

5. Look for the BBcode link(that's what it's called)

6. Paste that in your post.
